result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 4:20 PM Defendant Joanna Lilian Klemme appeared by phone.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn appeared by phone for Joanna Lilian Klemme.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. State filed motion to modify bond based on day reporting. Court rvd' updated report 50 tests done and all 50 negative, now in compliance with Day reporting. State- originally filed the motion with the original violation of day reporting, now Deft is compliant, requests Court to give Deft reminders. Defense, bond modification isn't necessary. Court treats this as a warning and tell's Deft she must  be in full compliance with day reporting , does not modify bond at this time.

10:37 AM Defendant Joanna Lilian Klemme appeared by phone.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn appeared by phone for Joanna Lilian Klemme.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
State's Motion to modify based on positive tests at Day Reporting, State notes that Deft was in court in a Bail/Bond hearing the same day as the tests. Requests increased cash bond.
Defense makes argument for Court to leave bond as is or requesting no more than $1000.00
Court orders additional $1000.00 cash bond - to be paid by 5pm tomorrow at Clerk of Courts office or turn self in. Same previous conditions.
Atty Pangburn notes that there was $1000.00 cash that was previously forfeited and should have been reinstated by Court Commissioner O'Rourke on 08/23/22 but does not see it reflected in court record.
Court orders previously $1000.00 that was forfeited on 08/22/2022 to be reinstated. Current bond total should be $3000.00 with $2000.00 already posted.
